transcript.content: [BLANK_AUDIO]
Senate will come to order,
sergeant at arms will close
the doors.
Members go to their their seats,
members and guests in the gallery
please silence all your electronic devices.

Leading the senate in prayers is Reverend Peter Milner
senate Chaplin all members and guests in the gallery will please
stand.
>> Let's pray heavenly father as we pause again today we acknowledge
it is you that is carrying us that is leading us a family and we
as you would encourage us each of us from our head to our toe that
these senators and the staff,
and even visitors might know that
you protect them and not only do you protect them but you love
them.
you have a deep concern for all they do and all they are it's in
Jesus name that we come and that we pray.
Amen.
>> Amen.
>> Senator Berger is recognized for a motion.
Thank you Mr president the journal of Monday June 20 2016 is been
examined and found to be correct I move that we dispense with the
reading of the journal and that it stands approved as written.
Without objection the journal for June 20 stands approved as written.

Senators we have leaves of absence requested without
objection granted for senators Daniel Bingham and Bryant.

senators we do have a nurse today with us today,
Denise Brigham
from Greenville, North Carolina is here,

to be recognized, thanks for serving the senate.

Senators upon the motion
of the Senators Wade and Berger of Guilford County,
the chair is
happy to extend courtesies of the gallery to 14 students from Southern
Guilford High School,
representing the future farmers of America.
Senators let's, come to order,
come to order.
We have 14 students from Southern Guilford High School representing
the future Farmers of America and their teachers Melanie Gibson
and Brad Hensley, they are here in Raleigh this week for the North
Carolina FFA state convention.
Southern Guilford FFA horse judging team placed first in the State
in April and will represent North Carolina at the National FFA
convention in Indianapolis in October.
So our friend from FFA if you will please and be recognized.
>>[APPLAUSE]

the.

class from

if you're in the gallery please

thanks for joining us today.

Their awards include,
the The glowing star, the Meritorious Service
Medal and the Iraq Campaign Medal.
Her husband Frank Collin serves as Senator Raven's intern.
If you're with us in the gallery please stand today.
Thank you for joining us.

[APPLAUSE].

>> Motions, Mr.
President.
>> Senator Apodaca yield forth your motions.

it needs to be

>> No objection so ordered.
>> Senate bill 363 up Mr.

I didn't have my glasses
proper, House bill 778 performance guarantee is on today's calendar

on
Transportation.
>> Transportation, without objection?
So ordered.
>> Senate bill 363 Wage in our local government assessments today's
calendar for concurrence vote,
it needs to go to committee on rules.
>> Third objection, so ordered.

>> You can send forward your report at the end of the page,
bring
that forward please.
>> [SILENCE]

on favor will ask to send

title and act provided names

Starting with public bills on third reading,
house bill 960.

>> House bill 960, Retirement credible service charter school.
>> Do we have any discussion debate?
Senator Heis, what purpose do you rise?
>>Speak to the bill.
>> Senator Heis you have the floor to speak to the bill.
>> Thank you Mr.
President and members of this senate,
after a review on this from
what we had yesterday what this bill specifically will do is that
any time the future looked to calculate the cost of credits,
we
were actually getting two sets of numbers from fiscal research,
one that returns the kind of investment we expect.
Which is about seven and a quarter,
one that returns right based
on the treasury note and all this will just get more information
to the general assembly,
I just could say that
I continue to constantly,
that we will make those decisions in the
future.
The two numbers need to openly be consistent.
The number we're expecting the investment to return,
we're having
to form that difference,
two needs to be the equivalent number
of what we're expecting to return when we're asking people to buy
in.
So that being said well there's just being additional information
I l ask for your support.
>> Do we have any further discussion or debate?
Hearing non the question before the house is the passage of Senate
committee substitute house bill 960 on it's third reading all in
favor vote aye opposed no five seconds will be allowed for the
voting clerk will record the Vote.
Apodaca aye.

47 having voted in the affirmative and zero in the
negative Senate committee substitute House Bill 960 passes its

Senate Committee substitute.

One bill for concurrence Senate Bill 303 clerk will
read.
>> Senate Bill 303 Regulatory Reform Act of 2016.
>> Senator
Barefoot is recognized.
>> Thank you Mr.
President members of the Senate the house has sent back to us their
Regulatory reform Act of 2016 and I ask that you not concur.
>> Senator Barefoot ask that you do not concur do we have any further
discussion or debate?
Hearing none the question before the Senate is the motion to concur
with the House committee substitute to send the Bill 303.
All in favor vote aye,
oppose vote No, five seconds to be allowed
for the voting and the clerk will record the vote.
Apodaca no

[INAUDIBLE] no.
One having vote in the affirmative and 46 in the negative,
the senate
does not concur on house committee substitute senate bill 303 and

Well that concludes our lengthy calendar for the day,

>> You got the floor senator
>> Republicans will
caucus mainly after session.

>> A brief moment of personal privilege
>> Senator Tillman you have
the floor for a moment of personal privileged
>> After consulting
with my consultant Senator Heis,
I recognized that he wasn't wrong
after all we didn't listen to your bill senator Wells.
But nevertheless in the future if we do when we have the option
what to do and those rates don't correspond senator we can have
a devastating effect on our retirement system.
So even though we want right we weren't wrong.
>> [LAUGH]
>> Any other notices or announcements.

>> Announcement
>> You have the floor senator
>> Mr president the
nominations committee is gonna meet as soon as we get down in the
room after session if we could and we can I think
And I think we only have one on the calendar
>> Anybody else, any
other business coming for the senate?
If not the chair recognizes Senator Berger for a motion.
>> Thank you Mr president I move that the senate adjourn subject

receipt of conference reports,
the receipt of committee reports,
the appointment of conferees,
ratification of bills and receipt
of House messages to reconvene on Wednesday,
June 22, 2016 at 12
PM.
>> The motion, the Senate do now adjourn subject to the stipulations
stated by Senator Berger to reconvene Wednesday,
June 22 to 12
pm second by Senator Foushee all in favor say aye.
>> Mr.
President, Mr.
President.
>> Senator Berger.
>> I'm advised by staff that the nomination's committee meeting
is at 3 O'clock and the staff will not be there until 3 O'clock.
>> Apodaca will by himself til three,
okay, very good.
[LAUGH]
All in favor say aye.
>> Aye.
>> Opposed no, senate stands adjourned.
